Question 40.Question: Please describe any differences in how it impacted your learning (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 40.Response: Generally feedback from teachers is limited but more valuable, whereas feedback from AI can be a lot more readily accessible but doesn't often provide the same amount of insight as teachers

Question 41.Question: Were there any differences in how the feedback made you feel (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 41.Response: No, generally I take anythign AI says with a grain of salt

Question 42.Question: Describe any other differences between the feedback you received from GenAI and your teacher.
Question 42.Response: GenAI feels very generic, often it gives overly wordy responses which aren't useful in actually improving your work, feedback from teachers (when time has been put into the feedback) is almost always better. In the case that the teacher hasn't put much time into the feedback which is quite common, AI can give more valuable feedback. It depends on the teacher really
